Description: Sack or bag made of a single piece of goat hair cloth, folded at the bottom and sewn together up the sides. Fringes on both sides of the bag's open upper end (the two ends of the cloth), on the lower side very worn and partly knotted. Near upper corners of lower side, remains of cords made of extended warp threads, on one corner surviving as two lengths of cord and a large knot, the remains of a handle.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), D street room 127A floor 2
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
